Discuss both these view and give your own opinion.
text: A large number of corporates have laid down some stringent guidelines regarding the dress codes of employees. While some believe that it is the quality of the job that is critical, others argue that how well employees are dressed is crucial. In this essay, I will discuss both sides of the argument, while I support the latter opinion.

On the first hand, some people believe that those, who dress aptly at work, might perform better than those who do not. The reason for this is that staff, in general, are the face of the organisation that they represent, dealing with and resolving issues of customers on a regular basis. To illustrate this point, an employee who is dressed smartly can create a positive impression of the organisation before their consumers. In contrast,  staff who lack basic atticates when dealing with customers, would certainly damage the reputation and image of the brand. As a result of this, it will affect the sales of the company.

On the other hand, I would argue that the quality of work is more relevant than how brilliantly an employee can dress. The main reason for this is that employees are paid to undertake tasks within a fixed time frame regardless of gender, caste, and religion. It is the performance that differentiates a high-performance employee from the rest. For example, allowing workers to wear comfortable clothes can enable them to spend less time getting ready and divert some of their extra time to their family instead, enhancing their productivity too owing to less stress.

In conclusion, although dressing smartly can enhance the performance of a few staff, it is the quality of work, I think, that matters at the end of the day. I think, companies should spend heavily on training and development of their employees.
